availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Brand Ammerman in Harrison County, Kentucky, on May 17, 1848. Father of Tabitha Ammerman, Francis Ammerman, Richard Ammerman, James Ammerman, Mary Ammerman, Catherine Ammerman, Annie Ammerman, and Eliza Ammerman. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Harrison County in1860. Farmer in Harrison County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 12.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 558.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 23.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 28B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June 1863, p. 6.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film 000216896, p. 182.
"William Ammerman (1820-1899)," Find A Grave, Memorial 80183282, accessed April 17, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80183282.
